title: Search Engines - MozMoz logoMenu openMenu closeSearchMoz logo
description: Your all-in-one suite of SEO essentials.
content: By: Rand Fishkin October 17, 2005 Admitting I was Wrong Search Engines It's never easy to admit to being dead wrong, but in this instance, it would be doing the SEO community a great disservice not to make my mistakes public. In a thread at SEOChat - More on Term Weight..., I abuse members of the notion that keyword density can be used to calculate the importance of a term or phrase in a given document.... Read this post By: Rand Fishkin October 11, 2005 Understanding Computer Logic Search Engines A great page from John Sofwa, a math PhD and founder of Vivomind Intelligence (who could really use a new website), gives a thorough explanation of many of the ... Read this post By: Rand Fishkin September 28, 2005 New Article Listing 93 Ranking Factors Search Engines With the help of some friends from SEOChat, I've compiled a list of 93 metrics that may play large or small roles in determining how search engines rank documents in a query. This list is by no means comprehensive, but it does offer a great deal of information about each factor, as well as a relative measure of each factor's perceived importanc... Read this post By: Rand Fishkin September 2, 2005 Mr. Cutts... Your Pants are on Fire Search Engines Matt Cutts is one of the friendliest, most fun people to be around at an SES conference. But, like all of us, he's not infalliable and is prone to make mistakes once in a while. Far be it from me to criticize him, however, as I too have notorious errors of judgement ... Read this post By: Rand Fishkin August 31, 2005 Decption at Yahoo about Index Size; Google still bigger Search Engines As much as it pains me to have to give ground to the industry giant, Google appears to still have the edge in index size. Despite Yahoo!'s claims to over 19 billion web documents indexed, in a very good report from earlier this week, Matthew Cheney and Mike Perry from the Univ... Read this post By: Rand Fishkin August 24, 2005 Google #1 in Machine Translation Search Engines This sort of thing really scares me. Via Matt's blog, Google recently placed #1 in every category in a US government (actually from the NIST Speech Group) sponsored ... Read this post By: Rand Fishkin August 19, 2005 Great Site for Learning about Term Weight Search Engines I stumbled across Professor Rich Ackerman's Theory of Information Retrieval Site today and found this excellent summary on the theory of normalized term weight. There's some nasty... Read this post By: Rand Fishkin August 17, 2005 The Wrong Ip Address Search Engines Many of us have heard rumors about Google banning IP addresses or even entire blocks of IPs based on spamming or manipulative activity coming from them. Here's a case of an SEO whose found exactly this to be the case. From the post: Google will not cache the index pages for any of the sites Incomming tra... Read this post By: Rand Fishkin July 28, 2005 Yahoo! Promoting Video Search with an Awards Site Search Engines Yahoo! is promoting, on their homepage no less, a video contest where users send in their favorite short videos - the promotion specifically features one of a bulldog riding on a skateboard. The videos are then consid... Read this post By: Rand Fishkin July 21, 2005 Revisiting On-Topic Analysis Search Engines Since I'm in the process of re-building the information architecture for two clients this week, I thought I'd re-visit Dr. Garcia's paper - On-Topic Analysis. For those who aren't familiar with the concept behind the research, on-topic analysis is a system that's designed to help you organize your site's content by topic ... Read this post By: Rand Fishkin July 20, 2005 Accuracy of Yahoo! Linkdomain Search Engines Today, Barry over at SERoundtable commented that Yahoo! appears to be having some serious issues with how many results its linkdomain command displays. Like Barry, I decided to take a deeper look into the links Yahoo! recognizes to SEOmoz.org. Here are some of the results: ... Read this post By: Rand Fishkin July 14, 2005 Did Search Engines Ever Use Keyword Density Search Engines While looking around for some tokenization databases to help me build a term weight analysis tool, I came across a Microsoft article from January of 1997 on the subject of text analysis. This paper discusses some of the elements used in text processing, topic detection and classification and clearly shows that in 1997, search engine... Read this post By: Rand Fishkin July 12, 2005 Natural Language Processing Software Search Engines In the field of IR, natural language processing is one of the most important tasks that an automated system must perform. The filtration & tokenization of text in particular is of great importance in order to be able to mathematically represent, classify and ultimately anal... Read this post By: Rand Fishkin June 22, 2005 MSN's New Ranking System - A Neural Network Search Engines MSN's blog on web search yesterday featured the following fascinating paragraph on the subject of a shift in their technology (proba...
